params.name: from
params.doc: Collect transactions created from this date forward, in ISO8601 format (yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSSZZ). Dependent on the “to” parameter

params.name: to
params.doc: Collect transactions created until this date, in ISO8601 format (yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSSZZ). Dependent on the “from” parameter

params.name: fromUpdated
params.doc: Collect transactions updated from this date forward, in ISO8601 format (yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSSZZ). Dependent on the “toUpdated” parameter

params.name: toUpdated
params.doc: Collect transactions updated until this date, in ISO8601 format (yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSSZZ). Dependent on the “forUpdated” parameter

params.name: appInstanceId
params.doc: Collect transactions completed from a specific app instance ID

params.name: paymentMethod
params.doc: Collect transactions completed with a specific payment method

params.name: offset
params.doc: Offset for pagination query. For use with the “limit” parameter

params.name: limit
params.doc: Limit for pagination query. For use with the “offset” parameter

params.name: order
params.doc: Sort date and amount fields using this format: field1:asc, field2:desc

params.name: status
params.doc: Collect transactions with a specific transaction status

params.name: paymentProvider
params.doc: Collect transactions completed by a specific payment provider (e.g., Paypal, Mercadopago, etc.)

params.name: currency
params.doc: Collect transactions completed in a specific currency

docs.summary: Use this REST API to collect some or all of a user’s transactions from their Wix site and integrate them into the user’s account in your platform.

examples.title: Example of Transactions List request

members.name: providerAccountId
members.doc: Identifier of account on providers side.

members.name: additionalData
members.doc: Any additional data related to this account.

members.name: connectedProviderAccountData
members.doc: Account data that is present only when method is connected.

members.name: showToBuyer
members.doc: Whether merchant has had selected this method to be available for making purchases.

members.name: id
members.doc:
Payment method ID.

 For example, `creditCard` or `payPal`.

docs.summary: For example, to create a recurring payment every month, set interval to 1 and frequency to MONTH. A trial period is also defined as frequency and interval pair, so a monthly 'subscription' can be defined, with a 14 day trial period.

members.name: billingCycles
members.doc: Number of billing cycles. Set to 0 by default, as a subscription of indefinite length

members.name: additionalCharges
members.doc: additional charges which are included in the order, like tax, shipping or discount (optional)

docs.summary: Additional charges or discounts included in this order

members.name: refundability
members.doc: ability to do refund on transaction

docs.summary: Whether this order is eligible for a refund
Reasons for ineligibility for a refund

members.name: fromUpdated
members.doc: updated date to start range from

members.name: appInstanceId
members.doc: filter with instance id of application

members.name: toUpdated
members.doc: updated date to end range with

members.name: to
members.doc: created date to end range with

members.name: merchantId
members.doc: identifier of merchant account (deprecated, you have to pass signed instance in Authorization header)

members.name: order
members.doc: fields to sort on in format `field1:asc, field2:desc` only date and amount allowed

members.name: from
members.doc: created date to start range from

examples.title: example of ListTransactionsResponse

members.name: pagination
members.doc: total number of transactions with filters applied

members.name: transactionTotals
members.doc: transactions amount and successful payments aggregated by currency

members.name: transactionFilters
members.doc: app ids and payment methods to filter on

members.name: country
members.doc:
**Optional**. Country in ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 format. When ommited, country is inferred based on site properties or
 geo location.

members.name: paymentMethod
members.doc:
Payment method ID.

 For example, `creditCard` or `payPal`.

members.name: email
members.doc:
Email to use for auto connecting selected payment method.

 This field is optional and when ommited, email from meta-site is used.

members.name: paymentMethods
members.doc: Payment methods to get suggestions for.

members.name: country
members.doc:
**Optional**. Country in ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 format. When ommited, country is inferred based on site properties or
 geo location.

members.name: email
members.doc: Email that will be used for auto-connection.

members.name: appInstanceId
members.doc: filter with instance id of application

members.name: pagination
members.doc: total number of transactions with filters applied

members.name: returnUrl
members.doc: URL to return to after the claim.

members.name: redirectUrl
members.doc: URL client should redirect user to.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • NOT_CLAIMED
  • FUNDS_HELD
  • CLAIMED
  • BLOCKED
  • SUSPENDED

Possible values are:
  • DAY
  • WEEK
  • MONTH
  • UNDEFINED

Possible values are:
  • SUBSCRIPTION_ACTIVE - recurring payment is active
  • SUBSCRIPTION_CANCELLED - recurring payments were cancelled by user
  • SUBSCRIPTION_FINISHED - the total billing cycles, including any trials and regular payment periods, were completed (not yet supported)
  • SUBSCRIPTION_PENDING - recurring payment is not active yet, waiting for the first payment
  • SUBSCRIPTION_UNDEFINED

Possible values are:
  • INITIALIZED
  • IN_PROCESS
  • APPROVED
  • PENDING
  • PENDING_MERCHANT
  • PENDING_BUYER
  • BUYER_CANCELED
  • TIMEOUT
  • REFUND
  • PARTIAL_REFUND
  • VOID
  • CHARGE_BACK
  • EXPIRED
  • DECLINED
  • FAILED
  • COMPLETED_FUNDS_HELD
  • TPA_CANCELED
  • OFFLINE
  • DISPUTE
  • UNDEFINED

Possible values are:
  • ALREADY_REFUNDED
  • PROVIDER_IS_DOWN
  • NOT_SUPPORTED
  • PENDING_REFUND
  • EXPIRED

Possible values are:
  • PENDING
  • SUCCEEDED
  • FAILED
